plants.name: Crocus vernus
plants.description: A bulbous perennial flowering plant often among the first to bloom in late winter or early spring, producing cup-shaped flowers that brighten early gardens.
plants.funFact: Crocuses are one of the first flowers to bloom, often emerging through snow, signaling the approaching spring.

plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: A flowering shrub prized for its large, showy blooms and glossy evergreen leaves, often blooming in late winter to early spring in mild climates.
plants.location: Eastern Asia (native), cultivated in mild temperate regions worldwide
plants.funFact: Camellias are important in Japanese culture and have been cultivated for centuries for their ornamental beauty.

plants.name: Helleborus niger
plants.description: A perennial plant that blooms from late winter to early spring, known for its nodding white flowers which sometimes appear during snow cover.
plants.funFact: Despite the name, it is not a rose but its white flowers resembling roses bloom around the Christmas season or shortly after.

plants.name: Mimosa pudica
plants.description: A tropical plant famous for its leaves that fold when touched, it flowers in the warm season with small pink spherical blooms typically seen from late winter to summer in the tropics.
plants.location: Tropical Americas and widely cultivated in tropical and subtropical areas
plants.funFact: Its rapid leaf movements are a defense mechanism against herbivores and environmental stress.
